a.title: Permanent Link: Coronavirus Updates and Resources

div.p:
While Hawthorn School District 73 buildings are currently closed, we have implemented a Remote Learning Plan for students. The closure is scheduled to continue through April 30. Students are expected back in school on May 1. Student, staff and stakeholder health, safety and well-being are our highest priorities. We continue to monitor the outbreak of the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) very closely, and are committed to providing regular updates to the community. We are following guidance from the Illinois Department of Public Health, Lake County Health Department and the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).
Below are links to updates and resources from District 73 and public health officials. We will update this page regularly, as new information becomes available.

ul.li: Hawthorn School Buildings Closed for the Rest of the School Year, 4-17-2020
Hawthorn School Buildings Closed for the Rest of the School Year, Spanish 4-17-2020
End of Spring Break Update Spanish, 3-28-2020
School Closure Update in Spanish, March 20, 2020
Teaching and Learning Update from Hawthorn District 73, March 20, 2020
Teaching and Learning Update in Spanish from Hawthorn District 73, March 20, 2020
School Closing and Meal Provision Update, 3-16-2020
School Closing and Meal Provision Update Spanish, 3-16-2020
Coronavirus Letter to Parents in Spanish 3-12-2020
Coronavirus FAQ for Hawthorn School District 73
Cancellation of After School Programs in Spanish

p.strong: from Local, State and National Officials

ul.li: Updates from the Illinois Department of Public Health
Coronavirus Updates and Resources from the Illinois State Board of Education
Hand Washing Tips from the Lake County Health Department
Starting April 13, Hawthorn’s meal service has a new schedule. If you are in need of the meal service, please fill out this form if you have not done so already.
My Pantry Express, an online source for groceries when in need
Teaching Kids at Home During Coronavirus: Pro Tips from Homeschoolers

The Illinois Department of Human Services has launched a support line called Call4Calm. If you would like to speak with a mental health professional, text the word “TALK” for English speakers and “HABLAR” for Spanish speakers to the number 552-020. You will soon be connected with a healthcare professional in our area. You may also text keywords like “unemployment,” “food,” or “shelter” to receive information and support. The Call4Calm service is free, and callers remain anonymous.

Birthday Breakfast with the Principal (for April birthdays)","description":"

All students with a birthday in April are invited to join Mr. Fredricksen for breakfast in the cafeteria at 8:00am.
